intro: Tylophora squarrosa, commonly known as the rough-stemmed tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that release small, hairy seeds. Tylophora squarrosa is often found in forested areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
